column1: Got word that my colleague and neighbor @RepJahanaHayes tested positive for #COVID   Praying for a speedy and smooth recovery for her.  Be extra safe out there friends.

2020 has been a really tough year. So it’s been a huge relief these last two nights to learn that Covid has been licked the economy is roaring and peace has been achieved in the Middle East. #RepublicanConvention2020
If the President was 10% as concerned with the 150000 Americans dead of Coronavirus as he is with vandalism in Portland there would be a lot fewer than 150000 Americans dead of Coronavirus.
I know that numbers are arbitrary. And they obscure the human stories behind them. But these are awful. We need to stay vigilant and focused. #CoronavirusUSA https://t.co/atS9mGFUf2

Was so moved this morning to (safely) meet the Rev. Patrick Collins of Old Greenwich First Congregational Church. He is placing a flag for every person in Connecticut lost to #COVID19  Today he went through 3000. https://t.co/ed3xb0sA82
We crossed the 2000 #COVID19 fatalities mark in Connecticut today. It’s impossible to imagine the pain that has been visited on so many of our friends and neighbors.

At some point this weekend the United States will become the country with the most #coronavirus deaths in the world.  Time to double down on keeping away from each other washing our hands and looking out for the vulnerable. #COVIDー19
@grnojne The fact that your COVID fatality numbers are low by a factor of 4 is the least dumb thing about your tweet.

Ok. Apparently I just did my official Facebook Live on Coronavirus out of my personal Facebook page. Did not imagine I would spend Easter weekend being mercilessly attacked by my college roommates but here we go....

My little sis is a doc in Pittsburgh tough as nails. She just reached out: “I have always handled crises in hospital but this is hard.”  We don’t ask for help in the Himes family. I know not recommending that.  Don’t close today w/out supporting a bunch of people. #COVID2019
For the rest of our lives each of us will carry around the question: when my people were dying did I do enough?  Be like Mario.   #COVID19 #coronavirus  https://t.co/pp5YL8jK8y
Me trying to figure out Webex zoom google hangout Facebook live twitter live for #WFH  #coronavirus #COVID19 https://t.co/DPnwhvwZpY
Home studio. The rickety nature of the apparatus is partly offset by the soothing vision of ⁦@LitchfieldDist⁩ bourbon acting as camera support. #COVID19 #coronavirus https://t.co/2siuhvvcT6
As this #COVID19 crisis intensifies in southwestern Connecticut stories of heroism kindness and creative connection are everywhere. Reply to this tweet with your story.
On @JohnLarsonCT teletown hall meeting just now @GovNedLamont says that a thousand nurses have come out of retirement in CT to help with the #COVID19 crisis. Heroes all!
This is important for CT and for Fairfield County which is still wildly disproportionately hit with the #coronavirus https://t.co/B8kFCdQ1NH

As debate ends I count 80 members in the gallery and maybe 120 on Floor. Getting close to a quorum. And a little too close for comfort. #coronavirus   This bill is getting done. Now on to making sure the $ gets out to the unemployed and the devastated.
We’re learning a lot about leadership in the face of the #coronavirus crisis. This for example is the opposite of leadership. https://t.co/1DqM765BNM
I’m in House as debate winds down on our Economic Rescue Bill. Expecting shenanigans despite strong bipartisan support. I see about 100 members here all with their 6 feet radiuses. #CoronaLockdown
The normally packed Longworth House Office building cafeteria. The eagle eyed will recognize ⁦@JoeNeguse⁩ @repcheri and ⁦@janschakowsky⁩ standing at a distance. #coronavirus https://t.co/0WNat4W5BK

And remember the people who keep us safe don’t get to work from home. Police fire EMS and healthcare workers are heroes ordinarily. Today they are superheroes. Happy to join ⁦Mayor @HWRilling⁩ today to say thanks. At a safe distance. #coronavirus #Norwalk https://t.co/6jDD43U9HK

The folks at @SoNo1420 have converted their operation to making hand sanitizer. Get some in SoNo if you’re low.   And their other products used responsibly will help ease this crisis. Cant lie I did my part to support this small biz! 🥃  #Norwalk #coronavirus https://t.co/Q1AcJZ36u6

There is meaningful relief for individuals businesses and states and municipalities in the coronavirus bill we are finalizing. Join my teletown hall tomorrow for specifics on how it will help you and yours. #coronavirus https://t.co/NgqPy8rieR

There’s a lot in this rescue bill and it ain’t done yet but am very glad that independent contractors the self-employed and gig workers will qualify for expanded unemployment insurance.  Recognition that we work differently than we did a generation ago. #coronavirus

Very pleased that we have reached agreement on a historically broad economic rescue package to combat the devastation of #coronavirus. Votes have to happen so no counting 🐔. But I will be getting info out about the package in the coming hours and days.

Glad to see the Fed take action this morning to help the economy. Time for Congress to step up with a bill that is PEOPLE STATE and SMALL BUSINESS focused.  This bill CANNOT be the vehicle for either side to get its long-desired policies implemented. #COVID19

MISINFORMATION ALERT  In his news conference today @realDonaldTrump told the nation that chloroquine has been approved by the FDA to treat Covid-19.   As @US_FDA clarified that is not true.  Chloroquine is dangerous or fatal if misused. Check with your doctor before taking.

After a long day of conference calls and telework went for a brisk three miler in the sun.   Not joining any Olympic teams soon but with gyms closed and social isolation exercise outside is the perfect antidote. #CoronavirusOutbreak https://t.co/j1MszWPaBZ

Just joined Greenwich First Selectman @fcamillo in the Emergency Operations Center for an update from our chiefs on preparations for #COVID19. Thanks for your leadership and service.  Stay safe and remember get your information from https://t.co/S8KSRoLE3j https://t.co/MdsJA0Jg1Q

At midnight last night the House passsed a bipartisan bill to support the financial security of families impacted by the #coronavirus outbreak. The Senate and President must act immediately to pass it into law. I will put out more info soon. In summary the bill includes: 1/5
Join me tomorrow morning (by phone!) for a Town Hall for the latest on Covid-19 and other topics of interest. https://t.co/ojPtBGrCZ8
You’ve seen these before. But it’s worth seeing them again. The things you do all day every day will help us contain COVID-19. https://t.co/lZ4swG6Uhe
No hay necesidad de entrar en pánico.   Ayude a prevenir la propagación de virus respiratorios como el COVID-19. https://t.co/ka6exP58KT
Thank you for that punditry. I’m hoping now that you can turn your attention back to Coronavirus and the forest fire in the economy. https://t.co/UF4yNcCVmV

Just coming off the Floor after passing the $8 billion Coronavirus Funding Bill. Resources will soon be out to help states and municipalities with their response and to turbocharge vaccine and therapy development.
